1.name: Voter Interface
1.description: Web portal and mobile application for voter authentication and ballot submission
vulnerabilities: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in candidate name display
Weak session management allowing session hijacking
Missing input validation on voter ID field
exploitation: Inject malicious script through candidate name parameter
Redirect voters to fake login page
impact: Public loss of confidence in digital voting
ethicalConsiderations: Testing could expose real voter data

2.name: Vote Processing Engine
2.description: Core component that validates, processes and commits votes to the blockchain
vulnerabilities: SQL injection in vote validation query
Integer overflow in vote counting logic
exploitation: Inject SQL to modify vote records before blockchain commit
Submit multiple votes simultaneously during race window
Forge digital signatures to submit fraudulent votes
Overflow vote counters to manipulate totals
impact: Constitutional crisis and loss of democratic legitimacy
ethicalConsiderations: Testing with real data could alter actual votes
Proof-of-concept could be weaponized by bad actors
Immediate disclosure needed to prevent election fraud

3.name: Blockchain Network
3.description: Distributed ledger system for immutable vote storage and verification
vulnerabilities: Smart contract integer underflow in vote tallying
Consensus mechanism manipulation through timing attacks
Private key exposure in deployment scripts
exploitation: Underflow vote counts to negative values
Time-based attacks to fork the blockchain
Extract private keys to control network nodes
impact: Blockchain fork creating parallel election results
Complete loss of vote immutability guarantee
ethicalConsiderations: Blockchain testing affects all network participants
Fork attacks could disrupt other applications
Coordinated disclosure needed with all stakeholders
